law.text: The candidate names shall be presented to the voters in the form prescribed by the general election law, except that no party emblem or distinguishing mark shall be used, save the words "School Candidates." The order in which the names of the candidates are to appear shall be determined by lot. As many additional spaces shall be left blank as there are members to be elected from the district or division as the case may be.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 427, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 360, sec. 46, effective July 15, 1982. -- Amended 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 88, sec. 3. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4399-25.
